back_cards.definition_en: A feeling or opinion about something or someone, often formed without conscious thought
back_cards.example_en: Her confident speech left a strong impression on the audience.

back_cards.definition_en: An effect or influence produced on the senses or mind
back_cards.example_en: The painting’s vibrant colors made a lasting impression on the visitors.

back_cards.definition_en: A vague or intuitive sense about a situation
back_cards.example_en: I had an impression that something was wrong during the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: An imitation of a person or thing, often for entertainment
back_cards.example_en: His impression of the president had everyone laughing at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A mark or indentation made by pressing something
back_cards.example_en: The fossil left a clear impression in the soft clay.

back_cards.definition_en: Physically damaged or in pieces
back_cards.example_en: The broken vase lay shattered on the floor.

back_cards.definition_en: Not working or malfunctioning
back_cards.example_en: The broken printer frustrated the entire office.

back_cards.definition_en: Emotionally hurt or devastated
back_cards.example_en: She felt broken after hearing the sad news.

back_cards.definition_en: Interrupted or disrupted
back_cards.example_en: The storm caused a broken connection during the video call.

back_cards.definition_en: Not kept, as in a promise or agreement
back_cards.example_en: His broken promise upset his friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A device that stores and provides electrical energy
back_cards.example_en: The phone’s battery died during the long trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of similar things used together
back_cards.example_en: A battery of tests was conducted to diagnose the illness.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of artillery or weapons
back_cards.example_en: The military deployed a battery of cannons on the hill.

back_cards.definition_en: An unlawful physical attack on someone
back_cards.example_en: He was charged with battery after the altercation.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of equipment for a specific purpose
back_cards.example_en: The chef used a battery of kitchen tools to prepare the meal.

back_cards.definition_en: A story or account of events, real or imagined
back_cards.example_en: The novel’s narrative captivated readers with its twists.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of presenting or understanding a situation
back_cards.example_en: The politician pushed a narrative of economic growth.

back_cards.definition_en: A sequence of events told in a particular order
back_cards.example_en: The documentary’s narrative followed the explorer’s journey.

back_cards.definition_en: A description or explanation in a specific context
back_cards.example_en: Her narrative about the project clarified its goals.

back_cards.definition_en: A spoken or written account in storytelling
back_cards.example_en: The teacher used a narrative to teach the history lesson.

back_cards.definition_en: To come into existence or begin
back_cards.example_en: New opportunities arise when you learn a new skill.

back_cards.definition_en: To occur as a result of something
back_cards.example_en: Problems can arise if you ignore the warning signs.

back_cards.definition_en: To stand up or get out of bed
back_cards.example_en: She arose early to catch the sunrise.

back_cards.definition_en: To emerge or become apparent
back_cards.example_en: Tensions arose during the heated debate.

back_cards.definition_en: To originate or stem from a source
back_cards.example_en: The conflict arose from a misunderstanding.

back_cards.definition_en: For the purpose or benefit of something or someone
back_cards.example_en: She stayed late for the sake of the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Out of consideration or regard for someone
back_cards.example_en: He kept quiet for his friend’s sake.

back_cards.definition_en: The reason or motive behind an action
back_cards.example_en: They argued for the sake of fairness.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize urgency or importance
back_cards.example_en: For heaven’s sake, please be careful!

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to a Japanese rice wine
back_cards.example_en: They toasted with a glass of sake at dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of bringing goods to a person or place
back_cards.example_en: The delivery of the package arrived on time.

back_cards.definition_en: The manner of speaking or presenting
back_cards.example_en: Her speech delivery was confident and clear.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of giving birth
back_cards.example_en: The hospital prepared for a safe delivery.

back_cards.definition_en: The provision of a service or item
back_cards.example_en: The restaurant offers free delivery on weekends.

back_cards.definition_en: The release or transfer of something
back_cards.example_en: The delivery of the verdict surprised the courtroom.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop feeling anger toward someone who wronged you
back_cards.example_en: She forgave her friend for forgetting her birthday.

back_cards.definition_en: To excuse or overlook a mistake or fault
back_cards.example_en: He forgave the error in the report.

back_cards.definition_en: To release someone from a debt or obligation
back_cards.example_en: The bank forgave part of the loan.

back_cards.definition_en: To let go of resentment in a personal context
back_cards.example_en: It took time, but she forgave her brother.

back_cards.definition_en: To grant pardon in a formal or religious sense
back_cards.example_en: The priest spoke of how to forgive sins.

back_cards.definition_en: Able to be seen with the eyes
back_cards.example_en: The stars were visible on the clear night.

back_cards.definition_en: Noticeable or apparent to others
back_cards.example_en: Her excitement was visible during the celebration.

back_cards.definition_en: Present or detectable in a situation
back_cards.example_en: There was no visible damage after the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: Accessible or available to view
back_cards.example_en: The report is now visible on the website.

back_cards.definition_en: Prominent or conspicuous in a context
back_cards.example_en: The leader’s support was visible at the event.

back_cards.definition_en: To a great degree or intensity
back_cards.example_en: It rained heavily all afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: With a lot of effort or force
back_cards.example_en: He breathed heavily after running.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that involves a large amount
back_cards.example_en: She relied heavily on her notes for the exam.

back_cards.definition_en: In a burdensome or oppressive manner
back_cards.example_en: The loss weighed heavily on his mind.

back_cards.definition_en: With strong influence or dependence
back_cards.example_en: The decision was heavily influenced by data.

back_cards.definition_en: Younger in age or lower in rank
back_cards.example_en: The junior team members learned from the seniors.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a younger person or student
back_cards.example_en: She’s a junior in high school this year.

back_cards.definition_en: Of a lower or subordinate position
back_cards.example_en: He started as a junior analyst at the firm.

back_cards.definition_en: Designed for younger individuals
back_cards.example_en: The junior soccer league is for kids under twelve.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating the younger of two with the same name
back_cards.example_en: John Smith Junior followed his father’s career.

back_cards.definition_en: A representative, especially in sales
back_cards.example_en: The sales rep visited the store to pitch new products.

back_cards.definition_en: Short for reputation
back_cards.example_en: She has a great rep for being reliable.

back_cards.definition_en: A repetition in exercise or training
back_cards.example_en: He did ten reps of push-ups at the gym.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a legislative body (short for representative)
back_cards.example_en: The rep voted on the new bill.

back_cards.definition_en: A fabric with a ribbed texture
back_cards.example_en: The curtain was made of a sturdy rep material.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being varied or different
back_cards.example_en: The city’s diversity made it culturally rich.

back_cards.definition_en: A range of different people or things
back_cards.example_en: The team valued diversity in skills and backgrounds.

back_cards.definition_en: Inclusion of various groups in a setting
back_cards.example_en: The company promoted diversity in its hiring.

back_cards.definition_en: Variety in nature or ecosystems
back_cards.example_en: The forest’s diversity supports many species.

back_cards.definition_en: Differences in perspectives or ideas
back_cards.example_en: Diversity of thought led to creative solutions.

back_cards.definition_en: A thin piece of cord or thread
back_cards.example_en: She tied the package with a string.

back_cards.definition_en: A sequence of similar things or events
back_cards.example_en: A string of wins boosted the team’s morale.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of characters in computing
back_cards.example_en: The programmer wrote a string of code.

back_cards.definition_en: A musical instrument’s cord for playing
back_cards.example_en: The guitar string snapped during the performance.

back_cards.definition_en: A line or series of objects
back_cards.example_en: A string of lights decorated the patio.

back_cards.definition_en: A legal action filed in court
back_cards.example_en: The company faced a lawsuit over the contract.

back_cards.definition_en: A dispute resolved through legal proceedings
back_cards.example_en: The lawsuit against the landlord was settled.

back_cards.definition_en: A claim brought to court for resolution
back_cards.example_en: She filed a lawsuit for unfair treatment.

back_cards.definition_en: A case involving civil law
back_cards.example_en: The lawsuit demanded compensation for damages.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal legal complaint
back_cards.example_en: The lawsuit accused the firm of negligence.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to the second of two things mentioned
back_cards.example_en: She chose the latter option, preferring tea.

back_cards.definition_en: Occurring nearer to the end of something
back_cards.example_en: The latter chapters of the book were exciting.

back_cards.definition_en: More recent or later in time
back_cards.example_en: His latter works were more experimental.

back_cards.definition_en: The last in a series of items
back_cards.example_en: Of the two plans, the latter was cheaper.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the end of a period
back_cards.example_en: The latter half of the year was busy.

back_cards.description_en: Attractive in a charming or endearing way
back_cards.example_en: The puppy’s cute face melted everyone’s hearts.
She wore a cute dress to the party.

back_cards.description_en: Clever or amusing in a playful way
back_cards.example_en: His cute joke made the kids laugh.
The café had a cute little patio.

back_cards.description_en: Charming in a youthful or innocent way
back_cards.example_en: The baby’s cute smile cheered up the room.

back_cards.definition_en: A person appointed to act for another
back_cards.example_en: The deputy handled the meeting in her absence.

back_cards.definition_en: A second-in-command in an organization
back_cards.example_en: The deputy sheriff patrolled the town.

back_cards.definition_en: A representative in a legislative body
back_cards.example_en: The deputy voted on the new policy.

back_cards.definition_en: An assistant with authority to act
back_cards.example_en: The deputy manager approved the request.

back_cards.definition_en: A substitute or stand-in for a leader
back_cards.example_en: The deputy led the team during the crisis.

back_cards.definition_en: To bring back to a former condition
back_cards.example_en: They worked to restore the old house.

back_cards.definition_en: To repair or renovate something damaged
back_cards.example_en: The museum restored the ancient painting.

back_cards.definition_en: To return something to its original state
back_cards.example_en: She restored the garden to its former beauty.

back_cards.definition_en: To reinstate or bring back into use
back_cards.example_en: The company restored the popular product.

back_cards.definition_en: To give back something lost or taken
back_cards.example_en: The court restored his stolen property.

back_cards.definition_en: A close friend or companion
back_cards.example_en: He went fishing with his buddy from school.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of friendly address
back_cards.example_en: Hey, buddy, can you help me out?

back_cards.definition_en: A partner in a shared activity
back_cards.example_en: My workout buddy keeps me motivated.

back_cards.definition_en: A person you know casually
back_cards.example_en: I met a buddy at the coffee shop.

back_cards.definition_en: A term used to refer to a stranger kindly
back_cards.example_en: Excuse me, buddy, you dropped your keys.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the mind or mental processes
back_cards.example_en: The therapy addressed her psychological needs.

back_cards.definition_en: Affecting emotions or behavior
back_cards.example_en: The movie had a psychological impact on viewers.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to the study of the mind
back_cards.example_en: He studied psychological theories in college.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving mental strategies or tactics
back_cards.example_en: The game required psychological strength.

back_cards.definition_en: Causing emotional or mental stress
back_cards.example_en: The situation created psychological pressure.

back_cards.definition_en: In addition to or apart from
back_cards.example_en: Besides pizza, they ordered salad.

back_cards.definition_en: Other than or except for
back_cards.example_en: No one besides her knew the secret.

back_cards.definition_en: As an additional consideration
back_cards.example_en: Besides cost, time was a concern.

back_cards.definition_en: In addition to something already mentioned
back_cards.example_en: She paints, and besides that, she writes.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce an extra point
back_cards.example_en: It’s late, and besides, I’m tired.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a very high degree of strength or force
back_cards.example_en: The intense heat made hiking difficult.

back_cards.definition_en: Showing strong feelings or focus
back_cards.example_en: Her intense focus helped her win the game.

back_cards.definition_en: Extremely serious or concentrated
back_cards.example_en: The meeting was an intense discussion.

back_cards.definition_en: Deeply felt or emotionally charged
back_cards.example_en: Their intense love was clear to everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving great effort or pressure
back_cards.example_en: The intense workout left him exhausted.

back_cards.definition_en: Kind and pleasant in behavior
back_cards.example_en: The friendly cashier greeted every customer.

back_cards.definition_en: Showing warmth or goodwill
back_cards.example_en: Their friendly welcome made us feel at home.

back_cards.definition_en: Supportive or favorable
back_cards.example_en: The app has a friendly user interface.

back_cards.definition_en: Not hostile, as in competition
back_cards.example_en: They played a friendly soccer match.

back_cards.definition_en: Welcoming or approachable
back_cards.example_en: The town is known for its friendly atmosphere.

back_cards.definition_en: A narrow road or path
back_cards.example_en: The lane led to a quiet farmhouse.

back_cards.definition_en: A marked division on a road for vehicles
back_cards.example_en: She stayed in the right lane while driving.

back_cards.definition_en: A path or track for specific use
back_cards.example_en: The swimmer practiced in the fast lane.

back_cards.definition_en: A route or course for travel
back_cards.example_en: The ship followed a shipping lane.

back_cards.definition_en: A figurative path or area of activity
back_cards.example_en: He found his lane in graphic design.

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling a need or desire for food
back_cards.example_en: After the hike, they were all hungry.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a strong desire or craving
back_cards.example_en: She was hungry for success in her career.

back_cards.definition_en: Lacking resources or nourishment
back_cards.example_en: The hungry plants needed more water.

back_cards.definition_en: Eager or enthusiastic about something
back_cards.example_en: He was hungry to learn new skills.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing a situation of scarcity
back_cards.example_en: The hungry market demanded more products.

back_cards.definition_en: A seed used as food
back_cards.example_en: She cooked chili with red beans.

back_cards.definition_en: A plant producing edible seeds
back_cards.example_en: The garden had rows of bean plants.

back_cards.definition_en: A type of coffee seed
back_cards.example_en: He ground fresh coffee beans for breakfast.

back_cards.definition_en: Slang for a person’s head
back_cards.example_en: Use your bean to solve the puzzle!

back_cards.definition_en: A small amount, often in slang
back_cards.example_en: He didn’t have a bean to his name.

back_cards.definition_en: A liquid or semi-liquid food served with dishes
back_cards.example_en: The pasta was topped with tomato sauce.

back_cards.definition_en: A flavorful liquid used in cooking
back_cards.example_en: She made a creamy sauce for the chicken.

back_cards.definition_en: Slang for boldness or attitude
back_cards.example_en: He’s got a lot of sauce for a new guy.

back_cards.definition_en: A condiment enhancing food
back_cards.example_en: The barbecue sauce was tangy and sweet.

back_cards.definition_en: Slang for alcoholic drink (dated)
back_cards.example_en: He stayed away from the sauce at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: To have control or power over something
back_cards.example_en: The team dominated the game from start to finish.

back_cards.definition_en: To be the most important or noticeable
back_cards.example_en: Her voice dominated the conversation.

back_cards.definition_en: To rule or govern authoritatively
back_cards.example_en: The empire dominated the region for centuries.

back_cards.definition_en: To excel or outperform in a field
back_cards.example_en: She dominated the competition with her skills.

back_cards.definition_en: To overshadow or take over
back_cards.example_en: The mountain dominated the landscape.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of evaluating or examining something
back_cards.example_en: The software underwent rigorous testing.

back_cards.definition_en: A process to check functionality or quality
back_cards.example_en: Product testing ensured safety for users.

back_cards.definition_en: An assessment of knowledge or skills
back_cards.example_en: The students prepared for math testing.

back_cards.definition_en: Trying something to see its effect
back_cards.example_en: Testing new recipes is her hobby.

back_cards.definition_en: A procedure to detect issues
back_cards.example_en: The lab conducted testing on the samples.

back_cards.definition_en: A clever act to deceive or fool someone
back_cards.example_en: The magician’s trick amazed the audience.

back_cards.definition_en: A practical joke or prank
back_cards.example_en: He played a trick on his brother.

back_cards.definition_en: A skillful or clever method
back_cards.example_en: She learned a trick to solve the puzzle.

back_cards.definition_en: A feat or stunt requiring skill
back_cards.example_en: The skateboarder performed a cool trick.

back_cards.definition_en: A habit or mannerism
back_cards.example_en: He has a trick of tapping his pen.

back_cards.definition_en: An imagined story or world
back_cards.example_en: The book is set in a fantasy realm with dragons.

back_cards.definition_en: A genre of imaginative fiction
back_cards.example_en: She loves reading fantasy novels.

back_cards.definition_en: A daydream or wishful thought
back_cards.example_en: Winning the lottery is a common fantasy.

back_cards.definition_en: An unrealistic or improbable idea
back_cards.example_en: His fantasy of fame kept him motivated.

back_cards.definition_en: A creative or imaginative activity
back_cards.example_en: The game lets you create your own fantasy.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being away or not present
back_cards.example_en: Her absence from the meeting was noticed.

back_cards.definition_en: A lack or nonexistence of something
back_cards.example_en: The absence of rain caused a drought.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of being gone
back_cards.example_en: He returned after a long absence.

back_cards.definition_en: A failure to have or include something
back_cards.example_en: The absence of evidence worried the lawyer.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of being distracted or inattentive
back_cards.example_en: His absence of mind led to mistakes.

back_cards.definition_en: Causing anger or displeasure
back_cards.example_en: His offensive comment upset the group.

back_cards.definition_en: Attacking or aggressive in nature
back_cards.example_en: The team launched an offensive strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: Unpleasant or disagreeable to the senses
back_cards.example_en: The offensive smell came from the trash.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving an attack in sports or war
back_cards.example_en: The offensive line protected the quarterback.

back_cards.definition_en: Rude or disrespectful
back_cards.example_en: Her offensive behavior shocked the guests.

back_cards.definition_en: An object representing something else
back_cards.example_en: The dove is a symbol of peace.

back_cards.definition_en: A sign or mark with a specific meaning
back_cards.example_en: The heart symbol means love.

back_cards.definition_en: A representation of an idea or concept
back_cards.example_en: The flag is a symbol of the nation.

back_cards.definition_en: A character used in writing or printing
back_cards.example_en: The dollar symbol is used for currency.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that stands for a larger idea
back_cards.example_en: The ring was a symbol of their commitment.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of identifying or acknowledging something
back_cards.example_en: Her face lit up with recognition when she saw him.

back_cards.definition_en: Acknowledgment for achievement or effort
back_cards.example_en: He received recognition for his hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to remember or identify
back_cards.example_en: The software uses facial recognition.

back_cards.definition_en: Official acceptance or approval
back_cards.example_en: The country sought recognition from the UN.

back_cards.definition_en: Appreciation or understanding of something
back_cards.example_en: She gained recognition for her talent.

back_cards.definition_en: To discover or notice something
back_cards.example_en: The sensor can detect smoke in the room.

back_cards.definition_en: To identify or find something hidden
back_cards.example_en: She detected a flaw in the plan.

back_cards.definition_en: To observe or perceive something subtle
back_cards.example_en: He detected a hint of sadness in her voice.

back_cards.definition_en: To uncover or reveal through investigation
back_cards.example_en: The police detected evidence at the scene.

back_cards.definition_en: To sense or pick up on something
back_cards.example_en: The dog detected a stranger nearby.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of measure used in cooking
back_cards.example_en: Add one tablespoon of sugar to the recipe.

back_cards.definition_en: A large spoon for serving or mixing
back_cards.example_en: She used a tablespoon to scoop the batter.

back_cards.definition_en: A measurement equal to three teaspoons
back_cards.example_en: The recipe called for a tablespoon of oil.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for precise ingredient amounts
back_cards.example_en: He measured the salt with a tablespoon.

back_cards.definition_en: A utensil used in food preparation
back_cards.example_en: The chef grabbed a tablespoon for the sauce.

back_cards.definition_en: To build or make something physical
back_cards.example_en: They plan to construct a new bridge.

back_cards.definition_en: To create or form an idea or system
back_cards.example_en: She constructed a theory based on data.

back_cards.definition_en: To assemble parts into a whole
back_cards.example_en: The team constructed a model rocket.

back_cards.definition_en: To put together carefully
back_cards.example_en: He constructed a detailed plan for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: To develop through careful effort
back_cards.example_en: They constructed a strong argument.

back_cards.definition_en: A sound expressing thought or hesitation
back_cards.example_en: Hmm, I’m not sure which option to choose.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to show doubt or contemplation
back_cards.example_en: Hmm, that doesn’t sound quite right.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of thinking or pondering
back_cards.example_en: Hmm, let me think about it for a moment.

back_cards.definition_en: A noise indicating uncertainty
back_cards.example_en: Hmm, where did I put my keys?

back_cards.definition_en: A murmur showing mild surprise or interest
back_cards.example_en: Hmm, that’s an interesting idea.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of agreeing or accepting something
back_cards.example_en: The project needed the manager’s approval.

back_cards.definition_en: Official permission or authorization
back_cards.example_en: The drug received government approval.

back_cards.definition_en: A favorable opinion or endorsement
back_cards.example_en: Her work earned the teacher’s approval.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of confirming or supporting
back_cards.example_en: The crowd’s approval cheered the performer.

back_cards.definition_en: Consent or agreement to a plan
back_cards.example_en: He sought approval for the new design.

back_cards.definition_en: A disease affecting the immune system (AIDS)
back_cards.example_en: Research on AIDS has led to better treatments.

back_cards.definition_en: Tools or devices that assist
back_cards.example_en: Hearing aids helped her enjoy music again.

back_cards.definition_en: Resources or support for a task
back_cards.example_en: The guidebook was one of the study aids.

back_cards.definition_en: Assistance or help given to others
back_cards.example_en: The charity provided aids to the community.

back_cards.definition_en: A plural term for helpful equipment
back_cards.example_en: Visual aids made the presentation clear.

back_cards.definition_en: In contrast or comparison to something
back_cards.example_en: She loves hiking, whereas he prefers staying indoors.

back_cards.definition_en: Introducing a statement of contrast
back_cards.example_en: The morning was sunny, whereas the afternoon was rainy.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to highlight a difference
back_cards.example_en: He’s very outgoing, whereas she’s quite shy.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating an opposing fact
back_cards.example_en: They arrived early, whereas we were late.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in formal or legal contexts
back_cards.example_en: The contract was signed, whereas the terms were clear.

back_cards.definition_en: Protecting against attack or criticism
back_cards.example_en: The team played a defensive strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: Intended to avoid harm or danger
back_cards.example_en: She took a defensive stance in the argument.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to protection in sports
back_cards.example_en: The defensive line blocked the opponents.

back_cards.definition_en: Overly sensitive to criticism
back_cards.example_en: He got defensive when asked about his work.

back_cards.definition_en: Designed to guard or shield
back_cards.example_en: The castle’s defensive walls were strong.

back_cards.definition_en: Freedom from control or influence
back_cards.example_en: The country celebrated its independence.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being self-reliant
back_cards.example_en: She valued her financial independence.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to act or think freely
back_cards.example_en: He gained independence after moving out.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of not depending on others
back_cards.example_en: The organization aimed for energy independence.

back_cards.definition_en: The quality of being autonomous
back_cards.example_en: Her independence inspired others.

back_cards.definition_en: To express regret for a mistake or offense
back_cards.example_en: She apologized for arriving late.

back_cards.definition_en: To say sorry for causing harm
back_cards.example_en: He apologized for breaking the glass.

back_cards.definition_en: To make amends for a wrong
back_cards.example_en: They apologized to restore the friendship.

back_cards.definition_en: To offer a formal expression of regret
back_cards.example_en: The company apologized for the error.

back_cards.definition_en: To acknowledge fault humbly
back_cards.example_en: I apologize if I upset you.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to Asia or its people
back_cards.example_en: The Asian market is growing rapidly.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing cultural aspects of Asia
back_cards.example_en: She enjoyed Asian cuisine at the festival.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to Asian heritage

back_cards.definition_en: Fit for a king or queen
back_cards.example_en: She received royal treatment at the hotel.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of superior or privileged people
back_cards.example_en: The elite gathered at the exclusive event.

back_cards.definition_en: The best or most skilled in a field
back_cards.example_en: The team was part of the athletic elite.

back_cards.definition_en: A select or powerful group
back_cards.example_en: The business elite influenced the policy.

back_cards.definition_en: Those with high status or ability
back_cards.example_en: She joined the academic elite.

back_cards.definition_en: A small, influential group
back_cards.example_en: The elite controlled the organization.

back_cards.definition_en: To take or hold possession of
back_cards.example_en: The army occupied the city.

back_cards.definition_en: To live or stay in a place
back_cards.example_en: They occupy a small apartment downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: To fill or take up time or space
back_cards.example_en: The project occupied all her time.

back_cards.definition_en: To engage or keep busy
back_cards.example_en: Games occupied the kids during the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: To take control by force
back_cards.example_en: Protesters occupied the public square.

back_cards.definition_en: Special importance or stress on something
back_cards.example_en: The teacher placed emphasis on teamwork.

back_cards.definition_en: A focus or priority in discussion
back_cards.example_en: The speech’s emphasis was on unity.

back_cards.definition_en: Stress in speech or writing
back_cards.example_en: Her emphasis on the word surprised me.

back_cards.definition_en: Highlighting a particular idea
back_cards.example_en: The campaign’s emphasis was on safety.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to highlight significance
back_cards.example_en: The report’s emphasis clarified the issue.

back_cards.definition_en: Covered or soaked with liquid
back_cards.example_en: Her clothes were wet from the rain.

back_cards.definition_en: Not yet dry or hardened
back_cards.example_en: The wet paint dripped on the floor.

back_cards.definition_en: Associated with water or moisture
back_cards.example_en: The wet grass sparkled in the sun.

back_cards.definition_en: Rainy or involving water
back_cards.example_en: It was a wet day for the picnic.

back_cards.definition_en: Soft or soggy from liquid
back_cards.example_en: The towel was wet after the spill.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of destroying or ruining
back_cards.example_en: The storm caused the destruction of the village.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being demolished
back_cards.example_en: The building’s destruction was planned.

back_cards.definition_en: The cause of ruin or damage
back_cards.example_en: Neglect led to the destruction of the car.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of breaking down completely
back_cards.example_en: The fire resulted in total destruction.

back_cards.definition_en: A force causing devastation
back_cards.example_en: War brought destruction to the region.
